intro: Leonia andina, commonly known as the Andean leonina, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the summer months. Leonia andina is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments and thrives in well-drained soils. It is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate foliage and unique appearance.
